availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mitchel Miller (Nicholas, Mason, Bourbon counties, KY, farmer & gentleman)

body.p: Nicholas County and Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Nicholas County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary A. Miller. Father of Mary E. Miller and Martha C. “Mattie” Miller. Married to Jemima E. Gano Miller in Mason County, Kentucky, on December 20, 1860. Father of Elizabeth Miller. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1850. Gentleman in Bourbon County in 1860. Farmer in Carlisle, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 3.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Millersburg, p. 332A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, 1851-1864, Film #000281844, p. 164 of 444 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film 994027-994058: Mason County Births, 1861, p. 6 of 6 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Nicholas County, Kentucky, Roll 16, p. 48, p. 415 of 766 of microfilm.
